results.title: Grapes and wine: a family tradition
results.creator_credit: ACMI, David Withers and Roberto Salvatore
results.brief_description: Lance Milne is a third generation farmer in Nangiloc-Colignan. He and his wife Marina own a large vineyard in Nangiloc and diversified their business by purchasing one of Mildura’s oldest wineries, Château Mildura. They supply their own grapes and grow citrus. Lance is a passionate horticulturalist and is heavily involved in preserving the important history of wine growing in the Mildura region.

results.title: Granville
results.brief_description: Depicts the aftermath of the railway disaster at Granville, New South Wales in February 1977. Eighty-two persons were killed and over eighty were injured. The film shows the rescue operations in action. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Grant Wood 1892-1942 (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Presents the story of Grant Wood, an American self-taught artist who painted the gentle curves of his neighbouring hills, the neatly ploughed fields, the daily routine of western life as well as such classic themes in American History as Paul Revere’s ride. The film brings together a collection of Grant Wood’s best work. Credits include: photography by John Lewis; music by Lan Adomian. Narrated by Henry Fonda.

results.title: Grant Mudford. Max Pam
results.creator_credit: Izon Productions, Brian Beaton, Kevin Ballantine, Jeff Atkinson and Roger Young
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Visual instincts : Australian contemporary photographers”.
Two thirty minute programs: 1. “Grant Mudford” Born in Australia in 1944, photographer, Grant Mudford, now lives and works in California. He prefers anonymous architectural subject matter photographed in a manner that transforms it. 2. “Max Pam” Born in Melbourne, Max Pam left at age 19 for Katmandu. He returned to Australia in 1984 having established an international reputation as a photographer of Asia. Photography, for Pam, has the capacity to capture certain moments which elude the writer, the filmmaker or the painter.

results.title: Granny lives in Galway
results.brief_description: An excerpt from the film ‘Fligh of the Doves’, focusing on a story about a brother and sister who escape from a cruel stepfather in England and search for their grandmother who lives in a cottage in Galway, Ireland. Based on the book by Walter Macken.

results.title: Grange Hill by Phil Redmond
results.brief_description: Adapted from the first series of the popular children’s program screened on the BBC in the 1980’s. For Form 1 Alpha at Grange Hill, their first year at high school will be an exciting and challenging one but with the help of the staff at Grange Hill, they’ll probably make it. Trisha tries to exercise her creativity by brightening up the school uniform, Benny has to put in some hard work to qualify for the football team, Judy is threatened by the school bullies and Tucker has too many encounters to mention. Starring Michael Percival, Denys Hawthorne, Dorothea Phillips and Carole Nimmons.

results.title: Grandfathers and revolutions
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, Pacific Film and Television Commission., Griffith University and Peter Hegedus
results.brief_description: A personal and compelling journey into the lives of the Hegedus family whose patriarch was the Prime Minister of Hungary during the bloody Hungarian Revolution of 1956. The documentary’s creator and Hegedus’s grandson, Peter, travels back to Hungary to determine whether his grandfather is really the man responsible for the deaths of those killed in the revolution. The documentary acts as Peter’s personal diary with entries including interviews with his grandfather and Hungarians who blame Hegedus for the deaths of relatives and friends during the revolution. (Awards: Winner of five international awards including Crystal Heart Award, Grand Prix Award - 22e Festival International du Film Independent and Grand Prix for Best Television Documentary - 14th Parnu International Documentary Festival).

results.title: Grandfather's mitten
results.brief_description: A puppet animated film with bright music about a family of mice who make their home in a discarded mitten and their succession of new boarders. Provides a lesson in cooperative living.

results.title: Grandeur and obedience; The Light of experience
results.creator_credit: BBC, Michael Gill and Peter Montagnon
results.brief_description:
Episode numbers 7 and 8 of Series “Civilisation”.
Part 7. Sir Kenneth Clarke presents Rome of the Counter-revolution - the Rome of Michelangelo and of Bernini. The Catholic Church in its fight against the Protestant North developed a new splendour symbolised by the glory of St. Peter’s. Part 8. The telescope and the microscope revealed new worlds in space and in a drop of water. The realism of Dutch painting took the observation of human character a stage further.
